## R Markdown

This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see <http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com>.

When you click the **Knit** button a document will be generated that includes both content as well as the output of any embedded R code chunks within the document. You can embed an R code chunk like this:

```{r cars}
summary(cars)
```

## Including Plots

You can also embed plots, for example:

```{r pressure, echo=FALSE}
plot(pressure)
```

Note that the `echo = FALSE` parameter was added to the code chunk to prevent printing of the R code that generated the plot.


```{r}
require(base)

(a_data_frame <- data.frame(
  x=letters[1:5],
  y=rnorm(5),
  z=runif(5)>0.5
))

a_data_frame

y <- rnorm(5)
names(y) <- month.name[1:5]
b_data_frame <- data.frame(
  x = letters[1:5],
  y=y,
  z=runif(5)>0.5
)

b_data_frame

names(y) <- month.name[1:5]
b_data_frame <- data.frame(
  x = letters[1:5],
  y=y,
  z=runif(5)>0.5,
  row.names = NULL
)

b_data_frame
rownames(b_data_frame)
colnames(b_data_frame)

nrow(b_data_frame)
ncol(b_data_frame)
dim(b_data_frame)

data.frame(
  x = 1,
  y = 2:3,
  z =4:7
)

b_data_frame[2:3,-2]
b_data_frame[2:3,-3]
b_data_frame[1:2,c(2,3)]
b_data_frame[1:2,c("x","y")]

subset(b_data_frame,y>-1|z)
subset(b_data_frame,y>-1|z,c("y","z"))

t(b_data_frame) ##P70

colSums(b_data_frame[,2:3])
colMeans(b_data_frame[,2:3])
```
